rComments: Prof. Kai-wing chow is a cool guy. He is funny, smart, and shares interesting stories. Lectures are extremely boring unless he decides to turn on the funny. He makes the class extremely easy because all the exam questions come from lecture notes. Overall, he's a awesome guy.

There are so many better Gen Ed's to take than this one.  Please do urself a favor & take something else other than this. I'm furious I didn't.  He is very hard to understand, straight powerpoint lecture, not sociable outside of class, and you have to read 4 novels and one is like the Chinese version of Shakespeare.  Nice guy, but terrible material
Although not very clear at times, he does a good job at teaching, especially China. Material is very easy. If you attend lectures it should be very easy to get an A.

I wouldn't recommend taking this class. The professor expects a high level of accuracy and detail in your midterm/essay/final (the only things that determine your grade), but fails to provide the same level of detail in his own lectures. He's boring, barely comprehensible, and avoids interacting with students outside of class.

Wow, terrible terrible lecturer. He will ask questions, and if no one answers them he will stare at the class until someone speaks. Seriously, one day it was for about 5 minutes. Will ramble on and on about nothing. The UIUC history dept rocks, but this guy is terrible

Very boring class, hard to sit through, especially when he rambles about things compltely unrelated to the course. I can't even count how many times he has mentioned the Iraq war in a class about anienct chinese history. Pretty harsh grader on exams. Kind of pompous, and rude to people who don't answer questions in class exactly how he wants you to

Lectures are rather boring as he is not easy to understand. Many times he rambles on and on about things that are unimportant, and hence detracts from his own syllabus and schedule by quite a large amount. Consequently the reading assignments and major paper that were due were all rushed in the end. I talked to him personally about the paper and he was very impatient and did not seem inclined to help.

Lecture is often hard to follow, and Japan was de-emphasized. Midterm and Final exam were not difficult, but not always an easy A. What is more relevant to how rewarding the class is your TA. I reccomend going to a diff. TA if the one you start with is disorganized or hard to follow. I like my TA, Chang and Shimuzu is supposed to be good as well.

I don't recommend the class because the TA sections have barely any relevance to the lectures or the exams. Exams are iffy because There's a ton of material that you cover and five different books that you have to read. It's not extremely hard, a B is very attainable but if this is for a gen ed try something more fun.

Sometimes you would think this professor is pretty interesting.  However, he is incredibly boring.  He just rambles a lot and names he pronouns are hard to identify unless you are looking at the spellings.  Very vague about exams and deadlines and what is due.  Not recommended.
papers and tests were pretty easy.  Lectures can get pretty boring, but the material is pretty interesting. Athough he has an accent, he's pretty clear.
